concept.title: Structure of a heap
concept.shortdesc: A heap consists of two lists of cells; the list of allocated cells and the list of free cells.

conbody.p: A heap simply consists of two lists of cells; one is the list of allocated cells and the other the list of free cells. Each list is anchored in the heap object.
A cell consists of a cell header followed by the body of the cell itself. The body of the cell is the area of memory which is considered allocated.
The cell header is a struct of type RHeap::SCell defined as part of the RHeap class in e32std.h.
